body:
I wasn't really sure of the difference so I looked it up to be sure: http://stackoverflow.com/a/16365367

> The downside is that since you aren't calling an explicit executable, it's got the potential for mistakes, and on multiuser systems security problems (if someone managed to get their executable called bash in your path, for example).

Is anyone concerned about that "downside"?
LGTM
@guozhangwang @ewencp @ijuma Could any of you give feedback on this PR? We really would like this to get into the next release.
Also cc @hachikuji

"This opens up a security hole in current authorization support of Kafka"
Can you explain why you think there is a security hole ?

"User info still needs to be obtained and passed to broker. Yes, using a common admin client that takes care of this will help."
Yes a NetworkClient to send requests to broker

"Let broker to the authentication."
once we move these requests to broker all kafka-acls need to is to grab the user credentials like consumer,producer do and send a request to kafka broker for add/remove acls. whats catch 22 here?

"Honestly, I do not see a reason for expecting that authorizer should trust kafka for deciding if it should let a user to perform CRUD on privileges, etc. One might say, we should restrict these operations to kafka's admin user only, which will take care of the issue of authorizing users via authorizer before allowing/denying their request of CRUD ops. For that just imagine you have to go to your admin every time you have to perform chmod/chown on topics you have created, even to see perms as part of your ls command."
1. What you mean by authorizer trusting kafka for deciding a user can perform admin actions or not.
   1.1 it already does by authorizing kafka authenticated user for all the other requests.
2. Admins can be determined by a config in kafka server.properties like super.users
3. If that's not convenient enough  admin can add additional users as "admin" into authorizer store using kafka-acls.sh or to give additional permissions to selected users using the same interface. 
4. As @Parth-Brahmbhatt pointed out if you have edit acl on a topic you can today add or remove acls for that topic as well.

The proposal we are making instead of the proposed changes in this PR is lets use the client/broker authentication which we already have to establish a session and authorize that session like we are doing for writes and reads from clients already. 

"kafka-acls.sh gets and passes user info directly to authorizer. This does not require waiting on KIP-4, however this is probably not a long term solution. "
Since this is not a long term solution and we already have temporary solution which is to trust zookeeper acls and authentication. 

Ideally all the requests and authorization should happen in kafka broker. We shouldn't be adding another authentication layer to authorizer and have another session. 
Lets have proper fix which is to move these requests to broker side and if this is getting delayed by KIP-4 we can file another jira to address authorizer specific requests.
Rebased and addressed the comments.
I am still +1 on the patch. @ijuma @hachikuji any thoughts
@harshach I'm a little doubtful about using the StopReplica handler to delete offsets, but the idea still makes sense to me.
LGTM. Filed separate JIRA for transient failure. Merged to trunk.

Thanks for the patch. Looks good overall. Just left a few minor comments. Also, in TopicCommand, when listing the available config options, could we add a description that messageFormat will be ignored if it's not consistent with the inter broker protocol setting?

Thank you @guozhangwang @ijuma, and sorry for my poor discription.

As @ijuma had explained, I thought this JIRA is for k.cluster.{BrokerEndPoint, EndPoint}.scala,
and it should consolidate o.a.k.common.utils.Utils's regex and these classes's regex into one.
If you create new JIRA ticket, cloud you consider about this?
@ijuma How about the testing result? : )

@junrao Should I leave this patch as is and review based on a local blocking timeout with plans to fully block in the future? Or should I revert to completely async? 

I don't feel strongly either way. My priority is to get this in, so I can create the other needed protocol messages and the admin client asap.

@harshach by security hole I mean, there is no way custom authorizers can restrict acls CRUD to authorized users, while allowing users to use kafka-acls.sh.

I had an offline chat with @granthenke and we might be able to get KIP-4 pieces in soon. I will punt on addressing the issue after KIP-4. Thanks for feedbacks.
@nehanarkhede

@granthenke : My preference is that if we want to do blocking, we do this consistently across all admin apis and do that in a state that we want in the long term. The local blocking implementation is probably not we want in the long term and doesn't have the full blocking semantic. Given that, for this patch, I'd recommend that we just go with the async implementation for now.

@junrao Perfect. I will submit an updated patch today to change back to async. I have created [KAFKA-3249](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3249) to track future discussions about a blocking option.
@junrao Thanks for the patient review. I think I have addressed previous comments. Could you take another look?
@becketqin : Thanks for the latest patch. It looks good to me. Once you address the last few minor comments, I can merge this in.
Don't think you meant to have KAFKA-2757 changes here.

@guozhangwang @gwenshap @ijuma @hachikuji  @junrao 
I have pushed an updated async patch based on the previous discussion.
Sorry for getting it wrong. Thanks for pointing out! @granthenke. It should be correct now.
LGTM
Cc @gwenshap
Cc @gwenshap
@granthenke Thanks for your review, and fair comments. I'll update the patch.
Review by @guozhangwang.
LGTM

I would be interested in what others think about the default value.

@rajinisivaram Mentioned on my comment on the old commit [here](https://github.com/vahidhashemian/kafka/commit/558e49a39dca3004203707b791dbd371fad0d5db#commitcomment-16199799) that default behavior for the new consumer in 0.9.0.0 and 0.9.0.1 is false because excluding the internal topics did not exist. Is that behavior we need to maintain or can we set the default to true for consistency and to cover the common case?
@becketqin : Thanks a lot for working on the patch! LGTM
Nice work @becketqin. And the reviewers too. :)
Rebased on trunk
For anyone interested I have also updated my WIP delete branch that depends on this PR: https://github.com/granthenke/kafka/compare/create-wire...granthenke:delete-wire
Rebased on trunk.
@ijuma patch looks good to me. Can you rebase with trunk
@happymap Any particular reason you closed this? It seems like a useful change.

@hachikuji I was trying to squash all my commits but couldn't find a way to do. So I created a new PR(https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/939), and now waiting for tests to pass. Once it passes, I will ask you to review. Thanks a lot!
If you squash locally, then you can force the push using 'git push -f'. Otherwise, the commits will get squashed when they are merged anyway.
@hachikuji I see. I didn't know that commits would be auto squashed when merged. This is good to know.
LGTM

Without digging in too much yet, one piece of overall feedback - having more high level comments to indicate intent of various codeblocks/methods would make it quicker/easier to understand what exactly you're testing and why.
@hachikuji Would you mind taking a look again?
@ZoneMayor Looks like a nice cleanup overall. Would you mind rebasing?
Thanks for the review @harshach, I've rebased the PR.

I had a few quite minor comments, but this looks good to me overall, and the tests are passing consistently when I run on aws.

Also - as mentioned when we chatted briefly, it would be good to update `build.gradle` and change this bit `task systemTestLibs(dependsOn: jar)` so that it depends on `testJar`
@ewencp Do you want to take a final look?

@Parth-Brahmbhatt : Thanks for the patch. It's useful to cleanup offsets on deleted topics. As @hachikuji mentioned, we can't drive the offset deletion off StopReplicaRequests. The main reason is that StopReplicaRequests are only sent to brokers that owns a replica of the deleted topic. However, the offsets are stored based on the internal offset topic and they may be stored on completely different brokers. The second reason is that we also send StopReplicaRequest when we move replicas to different brokers. In this case, the topic is still valid and we don't want to delete the offsets.

When a topic is deleted, the controller sends an UpdateMetadataRequest to every broker with leader set to LeaderDuringDelete. In MetadataCache.updateCache(), you will see the logic of removing the topic metadata when we see LeaderDuringDelete. This will be the right place to add the logic for deleting offsets.
Thanks for the review @harshach, I addressed your comment and rebased on trunk. Tests pass locally.
Thank @junrao and @ijuma so much for the great help on review!
Test failure is unrelated, the stream tests passed locally on my box.
LGTM
@frankscholten Tested locally and worked. Thanks. Nit-picking: could you remove the 2 empty lines between "selector.close..." and "long delay..." in testConnectionDelayDisconnected. Otherwise LGTM.

@hachikuji 
Already rebased this, would you mind to take a look ?

@ijuma  ping for review
How about the test : ) ?
LGTM. @ewencp if looks good to you would be good to merge. Thanks.
Hi @gwenshap, when you get a chance, could you please help review the code? Thank you!
LGTM. Thanks for improving the doc and especially for documenting "enable_jmx" - I bet lots of users will find it useful :)
LGTM. Thanks for the ping :)

@MayureshGharat, unfortunately this branch has conflicts and it needs to be merged/rebased against master. I also left a minor comment on the PR itself. If you address these, we can try and get it merged by a committer.

@guozhangwang @gwenshap @ijuma @hachikuji @junrao 
Ping for review.
@ijuma @ewencp Ping for review.
@gwenshap Ping for review.
Closing this for now. @edenhill, if you think we should include this change, please file a JIRA so that we can discuss it.
LGTM
@granthenke I didn't think about the documentation generation use case. I'll add the correct this and resubmit.
LGTM
LGTM, merged to trunk.
LGTM, merged to trunk.
cc @junrao
cc @hachikuji
@junrao Thanks for the review! I have updated the patch to address your comments.
Why we need to check offset limit for StreamTask as well?
We should not go beyond the committed offset when restoring a KTable store during startup. Without this, restore can store records that the ktable stream has not seen yet.
Review by @junrao

@hachikuji One last thing -- we require a new config for distributed mode now (`status.storage.topic`) and that doesn't exist in the configs for the system tests. I checked some tests (after merging with https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/949 to fix current brokenness) and the standalone tests seem ok but the distributed ones fail to start up connect because of the missing config. Should be a trivial fix.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM.

@ewencp Sure, no problem. The other thing I wanted to ask about is whether surfacing the exception message in the FAILED case was sufficient, or if we should include any information from the stack trace. What do you think?

@hachikuji Good question. It'd be nice to get stack trace info as well. Often that is enough to diagnose the problem and avoids the user having to dig through logs to pick out the original source of the issue.
Thanks @junrao
@lindong28 pinged me offline for this. +1, will push to trunk
I see. LGTM, and merged to trunk.
Merged to trunk.
@gwenshap @junrao i've seen a couple of PRs fail because of this error (long-running tests?).
test this please
@ijuma thanks for the review. I just updated this PR. I did not squash both commits on purpose (if you want me to squash them, just let me know.)
LGTM cc @gwenshap
Thanks Grant. Changed to string interpolation. @gwenshap can you merge.

Thanks for your comments @granthenke Unfortunately, I get an compile error I do not understand... (I commented your comment...) Btw: I had a look through the whole file, and there are some more thing we could improve. 1. use `BATCH_SIZE_CONFIG` instead of "batch.size" in `LINGER_MS_DOC` 2. use `LINGER_MS_CONFIG` instead of "linger.ms" in `LINGER_MS_DOC` 3. replace `{@link KafkaProducer#send()}` with `KafkaProducer.send()` in `MAX_BLOCK_MS_DOC` (JavaDoc markup does not work here...) 4. replace `{@link KafkaProducer#partitionsFor}` with `KafkaProducer.partitionsFor()` in `MAX_BLOCK_MS_DOC` (JavaDoc markup does not work here...) (There is also "block.on.buffer.full" in `BUFFER_MEMORY_DOC` which should actually be `BLOCK_ON_BUFFER_FULL_CONFIG`; however, this is deprecated and changing it gives the same error as above -- what does make sense it this case.) What do you think about this? Should I include some of it in this PR?
Yes! Love this. Maybe we need a flag for suspend=y? I find that I need it more often than not.
LGTM
yah good point @gwenshap! tbh, i always use that flag. let me add it as an option.

Thanks for the patch, just a few small comments. 

Could you change the title of the PR to: "KAFKA-3272: Add debugging options to kafka-run-class.sh so we can easily run remote debugging" so that it links to the jira?

Would you be interested in making the Windows .bat script match too?
LGTM.

@granthenke force-updated the commit with the changes you suggested. thanks!

let me poke around at the windows script.
@ewencp Ready for another look. I've added code to include the trace of the root cause in the output. Do you think we should just capture the entire stack trace?
@granthenke @christian-posta Do you think we should merge now and follow up on windows later? Or add windows to this PR and avoid diverging the scripts?
@gwenshap I am okay, if we merge and open a jira for windows. I just had one comment on the usage of `warn`. Otherwise LGTM.

@granthenke @gwenshap i've changed the warn to just "echo" and added the windows equivalent. 

windows batch file expansion rules.. learn something new everyday!
